alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 14 at 3:09PM EDT until August 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The warm air temperatures near 80 may cause people to underestimate the dangers of the cold water temperatures which are currently only in the mid 50s. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Anyone on boats or paddlecraft should use caution and be prepared for immersion. Dress for water temperatures and know how to perform rescues.
info.instruction: A Beach Hazards Statement is issued on days when a significant number of boats and paddlecraft are expected to be out on the water and when warm air temperatures may cause people to underestimate the danger of the cold water. Paddle smart from the start. Always wear your life jacket. Be aware of wind conditions, tides, and localized currents.
